Certainly! Here are a few examples of how Blackfoot artists have incorporated modern elements into their traditional art forms. 

1. The Blackfoot fashion designer, Jason Heavy Runner, incorporates traditional Blackfoot beadwork techniques into his contemporary fashion pieces. He creates unique dresses, jackets, and accessories that combine traditional designs and materials with modern cuts and fabrics.

2. Blackfoot artist Adrian Stimson created a series of paintings that combine traditional Plains Indian ledger art with modern pop culture images. For instance, his painting titled "Parked Pow Wow Princess" depicts a young woman dressed in traditional Native regalia sitting on a pile of tires in a parking lot.

3. Artist Lauren Crazybull works in a variety of mediums, from painting to embroidery to digital art. She often incorporates traditional Blackfoot motifs and designs into her pieces, but also draws inspiration from contemporary urban life. For instance, her "Everything is a Ceremony" artwork series explores themes of spirituality and mindfulness in the modern world.

These are just a few examples of how Blackfoot artists have incorporated modern elements into traditional art forms. In doing so, they are able to express their cultural heritage in new and exciting ways, while also creating contemporary art that is relevant to today's world.
